tours.site_seeing: Waterloo Park and West Montrose Covered Bridge
tours.activities: Ride a steam train and Have a picnic on a beach
tours.description: Waterloo is a city in Ontario, Canada. It is the smallest of three cities in the Regional Municipality of Waterloo, and is adjacent to the city of Kitchener. Kitchener and Waterloo are often jointly referred to as Kitchener–Waterloo, KW, or the Twin Cities.

tours.site_seeing: The Imperial Palace and The Sensō-ji Temple
tours.description: Tokyo, Japan’s busy capital, mixes the ultramodern and the traditional, from neon-lit skyscrapers to historic temples. The opulent Meiji Shinto Shrine is known for its towering gate and surrounding woods. The Imperial Palace sits amid large public gardens. The city's many museums offer exhibits ranging from classical art (in the Tokyo National Museum) to a reconstructed kabuki theater (in the Edo-Tokyo Museum).

tours.site_seeing: London Eye and Towe of London
tours.description: London is the capital and largest city of England and the United Kingdom. Standing on the River Thames in the south-east of England, at the head of its 50-mile (80 km) estuary leading to the North Sea, London has been a major settlement for two millennia. Londinium was founded by the Romans.

tours.site_seeing: The Brandenburg Gate and The Rebuilt Reichstag
tours.description: Berlin, Germany’s capital, dates to the 13th century. Reminders of the city's turbulent 20th-century history include its Holocaust memorial and the Berlin Wall's graffitied remains. Divided during the Cold War, its 18th-century Brandenburg Gate has become a symbol of reunification.

tours.activities: Musee d'Orsay and Cathedrale Notre-Dame de Paris
tours.description: Paris, France's capital, is a major European city and a global center for art, fashion, gastronomy and culture. Its 19th-century cityscape is crisscrossed by wide boulevards and the River Seine.

tours.site_seeing: CN Tower and Royal Ontario Museum
tours.activities: Hang Out in High Park and Visit the Royal Ontario Museum
tours.description: With over 14 years of public accounting and business advisory service experience in the Tongas, Ecuador, Canada, Botswana and the US, Agnes is the most seasoned and diversed member of the Vecta Corp. team.

tours.site_seeing: Federation Square and Royal Botanic Gardens
tours.activities: Take a street art tour and Take the City Circle tram.
tours.description: Melbourne is the coastal capital of the southeastern Australian state of Victoria. At the city's centre is the modern Federation Square development, with plazas, bars, and restaurants by the Yarra River.
